Question: A 26-year-old woman presents with severe headache,photophobia and neck stiffness. Among other investigations, a lumber puncture is earned out and CSF is sent for microscopy and culture, culture shows a growth of Neisseria meningetidis. What is likely to be the predominant cell type in the CSF?

A fit 21 year old man is admitted with an acute abdomen, subsequently diagnosed gastroenteritis. As part of the host immune response, which of the following immunoglobulins and cells are correctly paired?
25 year old man undergoes splenectomy following blunt abdominal trauma. Three days postoperative venous blood testing is likely to reveal:
A 42 year old woman has a cholecystectomy arid developes a self-limiting postoperative wound infection, by what process would bacterial ingestion have been enhanced?

A 23 year old man presents with three months following extraction of carious teeth with a plaque like infiltraition over the upper jaw with sinus formation. Yellow granules are present in the discharging pus. What is the most likely causative organism?

A 38 year old man in end stage renal disease resulting from polycystic kidney disease receives a cadaveric renal transplant. Good renal function is established but four weeks later deteriorates, the serum creatinine rising by 25%, which of the following processes is most likely to be responsible for this deterioration?

A 45 year old man has established cirrhosis. At a follow up appointment a palpable spleen four fingers breadth below the costal margin is noticed. Full blood counts have shown a persistent thrombocytopenia. Bone marrow examination shows megakaryocyte hyperplasia. What is the most likely cause of thrombocytopenia?
Option 1: Ineffective production in the bone marrow
Option 2: Platelet destruction in the bone marrow

Question: In a 9 year old child with cellulitis of the hand, which chronological sequence of immunoglobulin production is correct?
Option 1: Ig D precedes Ig E production
Option 2: Ig G precedes Ig A production
Option 3: Ig G precedes Ig E production

Question: A 12 year old boy presents to the emergency department two hours after helping his father cut the grass. He complains of rhinorrhea, itchy eyes, sneezing and a blocked nose. He is apyrexial with hemoglobin of 12, wbc 6000 with raised eosinophil count. Chest Xray is clear. Which immunoglobulin is most likely to cause this reaction?

A 45 year old homeless man presents with a cough and weight loss over three months. On examination his BMI is 19 and he has reduced breath sounds in the upper zone. His chest Xray shows a caveating lesion in the right upper lobe. He undergoes a bronchoscopy and a bronchial biopsy. The biopsy shows featureless necrosis surrounded by epitheloid macrophages and giant cells. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 20 year old man presents with abdominal pain and shock, he is found to have hemopritoneaum due to ruptured spleen. He denies any history of trauma what is the most likely predisposing cause of splenic rupture?

A 32 year old mountain climber presents to the outpatient clinic. He fell awkwardly, with excessive lateral flexion of his neck to the left side. He describes some paraesthesia over his right shoulder and lateral arm. Which appears to have been improving over the past hour. What is the most likely injury suggested by this history?
Option 1: Axonotmesis of the C5 nerve root
Option 2: Axonotmesis of the T1 nerve root
Option 3: Neuropraxia of the C5 nerve root
Option 4: neuropraxia of the t1 nerve root
Option 5: neurotmesis of the c5 nerve root
Correct Answer: Neuropraxia of the C5 nerve root

22 year old female presented with right iliac fossa pain, positive tenderness and rebound tenderness on examination, which predominant cell present after 24 hours from examination?

Patient undergone fever and rash immediately after latex gloves, which type of hypersensitivity reactions is responsible?

Post splenectomy, a patient has diffuse lung opacities with respiratory disorders which is the organism likely to cause this opacity?
A child fell and injured on left side of his arm with evidence of nerve injury, the affected area recovered fully. What is the most likely causing process?
Which of the following cell types is least likely to be found in a wound 1 week following injury?

17 year old lady with long standing anorexia nervosa is due to undergo excision of a lipoma. Which of the following nutritional deficiencies is most likely to be implicated in poor collagen formation as the wound heals?

a 34 year old man presents to the surgical clinic 8 months after a laparotomy removal of ruptured spleen. He complains of a nodule in the center of his laparotomy wound. This is explored surgically , and a stitch granuloma is found and exised. From which of the following cell types do granulomata arise?

A 33 year old man is involved in a road traffic accident. He is initially stable and transferred to the accident and emergency department. On arrival he is catheterized. One minute later he becomes hypotensive, with evidence of angioedema surrounding his penis. What is the most likely explanation for this event?

A 22 year old man undergoes a splenectomy for an iatrogenic splenic injury. On the second post operative day a full blood count is performed. Which of the following components of the full blood count is the first to be affected?
a 22 year old female is admitted to A&E with a splenic rupture. She has not been involved in any trauma. What infection can cause spontaneous splenic rupture?
A 49 year old female is due to undergo a renal transplant. Apart from ABO compitability which of the following is most important in matching donor and reciepient organs?
A 24 year old Caucasian man presents with splenomegaly and is found to have significant antibodies titres to EPV what is the diagnosis?

A 21 year old man fractures his ulna and radius. He is treated by means of a plaster cast, which is removed after four weeks. What pathological process is most likely to have affected immobilized muscles?

A 20 year old woman presents acutely with abdominal pain, imaging reveals a right ovarian cystic lesion which is excised. Histopathological examination shows a cyst lined by keratinizing stratified squamous epithelium. Areas of fat, muscle, thyroid and neural tissue are seen in the wall. What is the appropriate pathological designation for this lesion?

60 year old man is found to have a 2 cm diameter mass in the upper lobe of his lung, the lesion is excised, and is found that the lesion includes connective tissue, mature cartilage and ciliated epithelium. What is the most likely diagnosis?

50 year old man with a 30 year history of pancolitis undergoes survillence colonoscopy which reveals a plaque like lesion in the descending colon, biopsy reveals a pre-malignant lesion. What is the name of this pre-malignant change?
A 45 year old woman suffers form spina-bifida and is confined to a wheelchair. Her legs are not fully developed. What is the pathological process which has occurred in the legs?

A 45 year old woman presents to the hospital with jaundice. She under-went an ultrasound scan and is diagnosed with hepatocellular carcinoma affecting the left lobe of the liver, which virus is the most likely to be implicated?
Option 5: Human T cell lymph a trophic Virus 1

Question: A 36 year old patient presented with weight loss, cough, tiredness, multiple neck lymphadenopathy, and lateral aspect of tongue hairy lesions. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 55 chinese lady has conductive hearing loss, palatine ulcer and cervical lymphadenopathy, what is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following raises suspicion of testicular tumor?
Which one of the following is breast cancer tumor marker?
Which one of the following is tumor marker of melanoma?
Which virus from the following is implicated for cervical cancer?
A female patient has large appendicular mass associated with liver lesions which one is considered a urinary diagnostic marker for her condition?
A 5 year old boy presents to the clinic with short stature suggestive of achondroplasia. What is the genetic basis of his condition?
Which of the following is tumor suppressor gene?

A 60 year old non smoker presents with three months history of loss of weight, malaise and breathlessness. On examination, he has left supraclavicular lymph node enlargement. Chest radiograph reveals multiple bilateral opacites. What abnormality would a biopsy of left supraclavicular lymph node most probably show?
Option 4: Multiple abnormal mitotic figures in cells
Correct Answer: Multiple abnormal mitotic figures in cells

Question: A 73 year old heavy smoker presents with hemoptysis. On examination, he is cachectic and shows evidence of clubbing. Imaging shows a main bronchial tumor with massive mediastinal lymphadenopathy together with a widespread visceral metastases.
A 68 year old female who has never smoked presents with a mass at the periphery of her lung?

A 84 year old man presents with a cough and hemoptysis. He has a mosdest smoking history of 15 pack years. He is found to have a tumor located in the right main bronchus. With no evidence of metastatic disease. He decides to undergo treatment and he remains well for the time being:
79 year old woman with hypochromic microcytic anemia and axiallry and inguinal lymphadenopathy what is your diagnosis?

A 33 year old female presented with depression and irritability. Her investigations revealed low TSH and increased Ca. she was on antacids as treatment for her heart burn. The possible diagnosis of this condition is?
Liver biopsy was taken, showing birefringence apple green with congo red stain. What is your diagnosis of this condition?
63 year old man had undergone liver transplant. On staining the resected liver, it turned blue, what is the underlying pathology?
During parathyroidectomy, the surgeon wants to identify the parathyroid gland. Frozen section was done. What is the best answer describing the frozen section?
Option 2: But stain firstly then put the specimen
Option 4: Put cells on slide then stain with H&E
Correct Answer: Put cells on slide then stain with H&E

Question: 53 year old woman presented with cervical LN, on examination , supraclavicular, axillary and inguinal LN all enlarged. What is your possible diagnosis?
A man has cervical , inguinal and axillary lymph node enlargement his pathology showing Hodgkin lymphoma. Which cell in lymphoma originate?
Which type of lymphoma is associated with celiac disease?

A 55 year old smoker patient presented with hemoptysis and mucous phlegm. Pathological examination of his phlegm showing squamous cell in his sputum what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 85 year old man presents with a cough and hemoptysis. He has modest smoking history of 15 pack years. He is found to have a tumor located in the right main bronchus, with no evidence of metastatic disease his pathology showing keratin between flat cells. He decides to undergo any treatment, what is your diagnosis?

A patient had splenectomy 2 years ago regarding structure of spleen, macrophage in the spleen present mainly in?
Option 5: There is no macrophage in the spleen

Question: A patient had a breast cancer. On gene analysis she had a gene mutation affecting DNA replication, which phase of cell cycle is affected?
A patient underwent an inguinal hernia repair 4 days following the procedure, he developed fever and an abscess in the groin area. Which of the following best describes the process of inflammation?
Option 1: Infiltration of the tissue by neutrophils causing edema
Option 2: Increased vascular permeability causing edema and fluid accumulation then cell infiltration
Correct Answer: Increased vascular permeability causing edema and fluid accumulation then cell infiltration

Question: 50 year old man presents with three month history of a cough with sputum, he also admits to evening pyrexia and losing 6 kg and cavities in his upper lobes. Sputum shows acid fast bacilli. Prominent accumulation of which cell type will be surrounded?

A 65 year old man is seen as part of bowel screening program. He is found to have a 3 cm diameter lesion invading into submucosa which are presents at base of the stalk. Which term best describes these histological features?
A 60 year old man, who is a lifelong smoker, presents with increased dyspnea and chest infection. Histopathology of his phlegm have squamous cell. What is the infiltration of this process?
Option 1: Irreversible damage of the cell type in response to an external pathogen
Option 3: Response of vascularized tissue to autoimmune antibodies
Option 4: Reversible change of the cell type in response to localized injury
Option 5: Uncontrolled proliferation of clonal population of cells
Correct Answer: Reversible change of the cell type in response to localized injury

Question: A 30 year old man, who is a UK resident with longstanding HIV and low CD4 count, presents with generalized lymphadenopathy what is the cause of this process?

A 35 year old man presents with a three month history of cervical lymphadenopathy. A lymph node biopsy is carried out and Hodgkin lymphoma is diagnosed, which subtype of Hodgkin lymphoma will imply the worst prognosis?

A 27 year old woman is admitted as an emergency following a road traffic accident. She was the front seat passenger and was wearing a seat belt. She is tachycardic and hypotensive with upper left quadrant tenderness. Chest Xray confirms fractures of the 10, 11, ribs on the left side and US confirms splenic injury with continued bleeding. She undergoes an emergency splenectomy what prophylaxis does she need in the future?
Option 3: Pneumococcus, hemophilus influenza B, meningococcus A and C
Option 4: Pneumococcus, hemophilus influenza B, meningococcus A and C and flucloxacillin
Option 5: Pneumococcus, hemophilus influenza B, meningococcus A and C and penicillin
Correct Answer: Pneumococcus, hemophilus influenza B, meningococcus A and C and penicillin

Question: 45 year old woman presents with a neck lymph node. A biopsy of the node shows sarcoidosis. What is the cell predominant in the biopsy?

After histopathological examination of amyloid tissue with congo red stain, the color of this tissue will be which of the following?
Option 2: Congo red positive + blue under polarized light
Option 3: Congo red positive + green under polarized light
Option 4: Congo red positive + white under polarized light
Correct Answer: Congo red positive + green under polarized light
